result.markdown: --- title: "Probability Theory" author: "Geethika Tiramdas" subtitle: "Assignment solutions" toc: true number-sections: false --- # Assignment 1 From the picture: ![Probability Tree Given](../01_journal/01_probability_files/figure-html/01_tree.png){#fig-givenprob} We know: P(S) = 0.3 P(T) = 0.7 P(T | S) = 0.2 P(T | S) = 0.8 P(T | S) = 0.6 P(T | S) = 0.4 Referring to ![Probability Tree Referred](../01_journal/01_probability_files/figure-html/1280px-Probability_tree_diagram.svg.png){#fig-referprob} The solutions: * P(T ∩ S) = P(S) \* P(T | S) * P(T ∩ S) = P(S) \* P(T | S) * P(T ∩ S) = P(S) \* P(T | S) * P(T ∩ S) = P(S) \* P(T | S) ::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_5c9ce56aff0579a5979c5f246611baef'} ```{.r .cell-code} S <- 0.3 TgS <- 0.2 # 0.8 is Tbar given S TgSbar <- 0.6 # 0.4 is Tbar given Sbar TandS <- S * TgS TandSbar <- (1 - S) * TgSbar TbarandS <- S * (1 - TgS) TbarandSbar <- (1 - S) * (1 - TgSbar) print( paste( "Sum: ", ( TandS + TandSbar + TbarandS + TbarandSbar ) ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "Sum: 1" ``` ::: ::: # Assignment 2 ![Venn Diagram](../01_journal/01_probability_files/figure-html/venn_diagram.png){#fig-venn} From the venn diagram: * The percentage of customers using all three devices is + 5 or 0.5% of total customers * The percentage of customers using at least 2 devices + Customers using (Smartphones and Tablets) + (Tablet and Computer) + (Computer and Smartphone) + (all three) + 199 or 19.9% of customers * The percentage of customers using only one device + Customers using only smartphone + only Tablet + only computer + 801 or 80.1% of customers # Assignment 3 Given: * P(A) = 0.04 * P(B|A) = 0.97 * P(B|A) = 0.01 To find P(A|B) and P(A|B) 1. Calculate P(B): $$ P(B) = P(B|A) \cdot P(A) + P(B|\overline{A}) \cdot P(\overline{A}) $$ $$ P(B) = 0.97 \cdot 0.04 + 0.01 \cdot (1 - 0.04) \\ $$ $$ P(B) = 0.0484 $$ 2. Apply Bayes' Theorem: $$ P(A | B) = \frac{P(B | A) \cdot P(A)}{P(B)} \\ $$ $$ P (A | B) = \frac{0.97 \cdot 0.04}{0.0484}\\ $$ $$ P(A | B) = 0.791 $$ Similarly, $$ P(\overline{A} | B) = \frac{P(B | \overline{A}) \cdot P(\overline{A})}{P(B)} \\ $$ $$ P (\overline{A} | B) = \frac{0.01 \cdot (1 - 0.04)}{0.0484}\\ $$ $$ P(\overline{A} | B) = 0.209 $$ Now subsituting the values to the sentence: "These results show that in case the alarm is triggered, there is a probability of about **79.1%** that the product is flawless and a probability of about **20.9%** that the product is faulty".
